pr_title: Transfer providers discovered at build-time to new ClientBuilder instances

timeline.bodyText:
Previously I think there were REST Client tests in "main".
Does this just augment what's there? Any reason why they need to be separate?
timeline.author: kenfinnigan

replies.bodyText: Ah, I didn't realize we had a "main" IT module with an assortment of tests in it. I can move the the tests there to help keep build times down
replies.author: aguibert

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to support WriteInterceptor and ReadInterceptor as well ? Though it can be done as part of another PR for sure...
timeline.author: sberyozkin

replies.bodyText: hi @sberyozkin, yes I think that would also make sense. Since those interfaces are part of the javax.ws.rs.ext package, it would probably be best to register them in the core "resteasy-common" module. I'll open a follow-up PR with the additions and tests in the next day or so
replies.author: aguibert

replies.bodyText: Hi @aguibert sorry for a delay; thanks, that would be great...Cheers
replies.author: sberyozkin

timeline.message: Retain all ClientRequestFilter and ClientResponseFilter impls in case of programmatic registration

timeline.bodyText: @kenfinnigan can you please re-review? I took your suggestion and moved the ITs to the "main" project, which exposed a new bug on the SSL builder path in native mode. I've included the fix on these highlighted lines which mirrors what is done in org.jboss.resteasy.microprofile.client.RestClientBuilderImpl.build(Class<T>)
